channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-3055] start CollationTest2 testDefaultCollation fails with java.sql.SQLException: Import error on line 7 of file extinout\names.dat: Read endOfFile at unexpected place on line 7.
item.description:

item.summary: start CollationTest2 testDefaultCollation fails with java.sql.SQLException: Import error on line 7 of file extinout\names.dat: Read endOfFile at unexpected place on line 7.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Note: this does not occur with 10.3. because with 10.3 this test gets skipped. (See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-2703 related revisions 542697 and 555421 for the adding and removing of this skipping code. 555421 has not been backported, so in 10.3 this test is still skipped with jdk142 and j9).

Attaching a repro for this issue, using names.dat generated by the test.
Also attaching jdk14 output.

output of repro3055 with weme6.1. Comparing this with the jdk14 output shows that the problem is that the weme6.1 (a.k.a. 'j9') jvm does not handle all characters correctly.

The problem does not occur when the Codeset used to create the InputStreamReader in the test case is null, but it does show up when it's set to UTF-16. UTF-16 is what it is set when we run the CollationTest2 (and I think otherwise also with Derby).

I have reported this issue to the jvm vendor (IBM).

I will make this test case skip with JSR169.
See also DERBY-2546 for another weme6.1 UTF-16 issue with import.
marking invalid as this is a jvm issue, not a derby bug.
